publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-616 Bill Butler: Combating Sectarianism—That the Parliament warmly welcomes the launch of Her Majesty’s Inspectorate of Education’s Count Us In - Promoting Understanding and Combating Sectarianism good practice guide which outlines positive examples of promoting religious tolerance and challenging sectarian attitudes in Scotland’s schools and communities; embraces the fact that Scotland is a multicultural, diverse society; acknowledges the significant strides made in recent years in tackling sectarianism; recognises the vital work being done with young people through educational initiatives such as the twinning of denominational and non-denominational schools and the efforts of organisations such as Nil by Mouth, and hopes that all sections of Scottish society and government will continue to support the campaign to free Scotland from sectarianism. Supported by: Cathy Jamieson*, Cathy Peattie*, George Foulkes*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Paul Martin*, Bill Kidd*, Patricia Ferguson*, Alex Neil*, David Stewart*, Karen Gillon*, Marlyn Glen*, Liam McArthur*

S3M-616 Combating Sectarianism (lodged on 3 October 2007) Karen Whitefield*, Jackie Baillie*, Elaine Smith*, Robin Harper*, Rob Gibson*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Jamie Hepburn*, Des McNulty*, Trish Godman*, Kenneth Gibson*, Mr Frank McAveety*, James Kelly*, Hugh O’Donnell*, John Park*, Elaine Murray*, Robert Brown*, Bill Wilson*, Mary Mulligan*, Gil Paterson*, Ian McKee*

S3M-616 Bill Butler: Combating Sectarianism—That the Parliament warmly welcomes the launch of Her Majesty’s Inspectorate of Education’s Count Us In - Promoting Understanding and Combating Sectarianism good practice guide which outlines positive examples of promoting religious tolerance and challenging sectarian attitudes in Scotland’s schools and communities; embraces the fact that Scotland is a multicultural, diverse society; acknowledges the significant strides made in recent years in tackling sectarianism; recognises the vital work being done with young people through educational initiatives such as the twinning of denominational and non-denominational schools and the efforts of organisations such as Nil by Mouth, and hopes that all sections of Scottish society and government will continue to support the campaign to free Scotland from sectarianism. Supported by: Cathy Jamieson, Cathy Peattie, George Foulkes, Ms Wendy Alexander, Paul Martin, Bill Kidd, Patricia Ferguson, Alex Neil, David Stewart, Karen Gillon, Marlyn Glen, Liam McArthur, Karen Whitefield, Jackie Baillie, Elaine Smith, Robin Harper, Rob Gibson, Joe FitzPatrick, Jamie Hepburn, Des McNulty, Trish Godman, Kenneth Gibson, Mr Frank McAveety, James Kelly, Hugh O’Donnell, John Park, Elaine Murray, Robert Brown, Bill Wilson, Mary Mulligan, Gil Paterson, Ian McKee, Ken Macintosh*
S3M-616 Combating Sectarianism (lodged on 3 October 2007) Helen Eadie*, Christine Grahame*
S3M-616 Combating Sectarianism (lodged on 3 October 2007) Jack McConnell*, David Whitton*, Hugh Henry*, Rhona Brankin*
S3M-616 Combating Sectarianism (lodged on 3 October 2007) Michael McMahon*
S3M-616 Combating Sectarianism (lodged on 3 October 2007) Michael Matheson*, Dr Richard Simpson*
S3M-616 Combating Sectarianism (lodged on 3 October 2007) Rhoda Grant*, Tom McCabe*
S3M-616 Combating Sectarianism (lodged on 3 October 2007) Peter Peacock*
